pl.elka.mkoi.math.base

Class BigIntDiscreteLogarithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.elka.mkoi.math.base.BigIntDiscreteLogarithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DiscreteLogarithm<java.math.BigInteger>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BabyStepGiantStep

    public abstract class BigIntDiscreteLogarithm
extends java.lang.Object
implements DiscreteLogarithm<java.math.BigInteger>
    Abstract class implementing DiscreteLogarithm. It provides required methods to solve discrete algorithm problem using big numbers. Class BigInteger will be used in any calculations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BigIntDiscreteLogarithm()
      EmptyConsoleLogger is used - no calculations will be logged on ConsolePanel
      BigIntDiscreteLogarithm(ConsoleLogger logger)
      Custom ConsoleLogger is used to log calculations on ConsolePanel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BigIntDiscreteLogarithm

        public BigIntDiscreteLogarithm()
        EmptyConsoleLogger is used - no calculations will be logged on ConsolePanel

      • BigIntDiscreteLogarithm

        public BigIntDiscreteLogarithm(ConsoleLogger logger)
        Custom ConsoleLogger is used to log calculations on ConsolePanel. If logger is null, then EmptyConsoleLogger will be used.
        Parameters:
        logger - ConsoleLogger

    • Method Detail

      • subtractOne

        protected java.math.BigInteger subtractOne(java.math.BigInteger m)
        Subtract one from BigInteger.
        Parameters:
        m - value to subtract
        Returns:
        subtraction result

      • sqrt

        public java.math.BigInteger sqrt(java.math.BigInteger x)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Calculate square root with ceil.
        Parameters:
        x - number to calculate sqrt for
        Returns:
        square root with ceil
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when input number is negative

      • forceLog

        protected void forceLog(java.lang.String text)
        Logging is forced using custom logger, despite logger is not set as customLogger
        Parameters:
        text - text to log

      • logCalculation

        protected void logCalculation(java.lang.String text)
        Log calculation using logger. If logger is set as emptyLogger then nothing is logged. If logger is set as customLogger and customLogger is not null, then text is being logged on ConsolePanel.
        Parameters:
        text - text to log on ConsolePanel.

      • setShowCalculation

        public void setShowCalculation(boolean showCalculation)
        Enables or disables logging on ConsolePanel. If logging is enabled and customLogger is not null, then text will logged, else not.
        Parameters:
        showCalculation - true to log on ConsolePanel, else false
